result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:39 a.m. Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson. Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski statement/agreement reached to restitution of $95,000. Erickson statement-stipulates to $95,000 restitution; defendant has already paid $15,000, leaving balance of $80,000 owed. Wigglesworth in agreement. Court adopts stipulation; orders restitution of $95,000; JOC amended. Sowinski statement. 10:43 a.m. off record. 10:44 a.m. back on record. All parties present. Erickson statement--stipulation if defendant can come up with $20,000 by 8/10/17, entire restitution would drop from $95,000 to $89,000, less $15,000 previously paid. Sowinski agrees/statement. Court statement--proof required to the court if $20,000 payment made. 10:48 a.m.
Defendant's Exh. 1 - 11/7/16 software license expense
Hearing on February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

9:14 a.m.Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement--speaks of materials to be made available to the defense. Sowinski statement--speaks to software; cost/fee; not State's obligation for the expense. Erickson statement--objects to cost/fees by defendant for material interpretation. State calls Dave Kroll, former Detective Sergeant for Oneida County Sheriff's Dept. (forensic tech), sworn, questioned by the court; direct by Sowinski. Court accepts witness as expert. Cross by Erickson. Erickson statement. Defendant's Exh. 1 - 11/7/16 software license expense marked, offered, received. Sowinski argument--bank statements available for review at MPD. Erickson statement--requesting Quick books and missing bank statements. Court statement to MPD paper documents available. Erickson statement to documents--claims not all bank statements included. Court statement. Sowinski statement--claims all copies at MPD. Sowinski/Court statement. Court statement--does not order State to pay for equipment to get into computer; would encourage Kroll/State time to see if info. readily available; again encourages counsel to come up with number for restitution. Erickson statement--ready to proceed. Court statement--counsel to contact JA for hearing; encourages further discussion between parties to reach conclusion. 10:27 a.m. adj.

11:05 a m. Attorney Lindsay L Erickson in court appearing by telephone with leave of court.   Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Erickson states can't open material provided as discovery without purchasing $4,000 program or hire a forensic person to open documents; Erickson states she has been asking for discovery for years. Sowinski statement to discovery. Court questions whether disk would be available to be played at Sheriff's Dept. Sowinski states that it would take hours for evidence tech to obtain Quick Books information. Court needs to hear expert testimony regarding discovery - including Defense cost of converting discovery - has not provided letter to District Attorney. Sheriff's Dept Croll to talk to author of letter read by defense counsel regarding accessing information without additional cost (except time) to either party. Sowinski statement that Croll is now private counsel and his time is not free. Court would like Croll to appear before him and explain process. Sowinski requests that defense contact private companies that provide same service for accessing files and provide estimate of cost. Sowinski states that she has informed Defense counsel that documentation is available at Minocqua PD and defense has not availed of opportunity to inspect. Court states Schweiger needs to be available to inspect documents at Minocqua PD. Adj. 11:47 a.m.  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Exh. 1 (7/16/15 Davis letter to State/summary of theft costs) - KEPT IN CRIMINAL DRAWER

8:42 a.m. Attorney Lindsay L Erickson in court. Defendant Brenda Wigglesworth appears by phone. Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court summarizes status of case. Sowinski statement to today's proceedings--proposes begin testimony today; stipulates to adjournment to allow defendant time for further preparation. Erickson statement--still has not received adequate discovery from the State; defendant unable to appear due to medical event; requests adjournment. Court statement--references s. 973.20; speaks to restitution hearing criteria--no discovery without good cause shown; expert analysis/opinion; prior adjournments. Erickson statement--defendant's position on restitution amount. Court statement. Sowinski statement. Court explains burden of proof of loss/factors of restitution. Erickson speaks to discovery. Court/Erickson statement. Court considers actions by counsel as waiver of time limits regarding restitution. State calls Andrew Davis, CPA/expert, sworn. Court advises Wigglesworth if she needs a break/time to speak to attorney, let Court know. Erickson stipulates Davis being an expert. Direct by State. State's Exh. 1 (7/16/15 Davis letter to State/summary of theft costs) marked. State's Exh. 2 (5/12/16 Davis letter to DA) marked. 10:11 a.m. off the record. 10:38 a.m. back on record. All parties present with Defendant Wigglesworth by phone. Sowinski statement/continues direct of Davis. State offers State's Exh. 1 & 2. Erickson objects to State's Exh. 2. Court receives State's Exh. 1; State's Exh. 2 is not received at this time but will remain with case. Sowinski statement as to additional witnesses. State calls Michael Hayman, veterinarian, sworn, direct. Cross by Erickson. Court addresses gallery/quiet/no comments or will have to leave courtroom. Questioned by the Court. Erickson continues cross. Sowinski redirect. Court addresses Wigglesworth/requests to talk with attorney. 11:36 a.m. off record. 11:45 a.m. back on record. All parties present with Defendant Wigglesworth by phone. Recross of Hayman by Erickson. Redirect by Sowinski. Andrew Davis back on witness stand/reminded by the Court still under oath. Cross by Erickson; reserves right to ask additional questions at future hearing. Sowinski redirect. State's Exh. 3 (Packet of documents accompanying 5/12/16 letter) marked; identified by witness. State does not offer at this time. Erickson/Sowinski statement. Davis questioned by the court. 12:54 p.m. recess. 2:14 p.m. Back on record. All parties present with Defendant Wigglesworth appearing by phone. State calls M. H., sworn, direct; questioned by the Court. Witness excused/may be recalled at a later date. Erickson requests continuance for additional testimony. Court statement. 2:57 p.m. off record. 3:06 p.m. back on record. All parties present; defendant Wigglesworth by phone. Court statement. Sowinski/Erickson statement. Erickson states she will provide documentation to State when completed. Continued restitution hearing scheduled for 11/14/16 at 8:30 a.m. Adj. 3:11 p.m.
Restitution hearing on September 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order
Restitution hearing at 06-20-2016 08:30 am
Restitution hearing at 05-13-2016 08:30 am
Restitution hearing at 05-13-2016 08:30 am
on restitution - includes cover letter
Restitution hearing at 02-02-2016 08:30 am
Restitution hearing at 02-03-2016 08:30 am
6-26-15 plea hearing
State's Exhibit 1

9:06 a.m. Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pre-sentence investigation report received by all parties. Dr. David Theuerkauf statement to Court. Audrey Theuerkauf statement to Court. Dr. Michael Hayman statement to Court. Michlig marks Exhibit 1 - Letter from accountant-Received. Michlig statement to Court. Erickson statement to Court. Defendant statement to Court. Court statement on sentencing. Advised of ineligible voting rights -
Court Sentence

Jail - 9 months with Huber for all purposes to be remanded immediately
WHS/POP - 5 yrs.
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Restitution - to be determined
Restitution of $15,000 to be tendered from Attorney Erickson trust account to District Attorney's Office 
All other conditions as outlined in PSI.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given
Restitution hearing to be scheduled.
Adj. 10:25 a.m.

2:13 p.m.  Attorney Lindsay L Erickson appeared telephonically with leave of court. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion was held off record regarding new date/psi/obtaining additional records from da's office. Court sets sentencing hearing for September 18, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. 09-18-15. Adj. 2:14 p.m.

08:38 a.m. - Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig statement to resolution of case.  Joint request for PSI - Restitution Hearing is also being requested uner 973.20(13)(a)4 after sentencing.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Bail continued.  Adjourned 09:01 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
Plea hearing at 06-26-2015 08:30 am
State's Reply to Discovery continued

01:56 pm - Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig states case has not yet been resolved.  Erickson states a forensic accountant has been hired by defense - waiting for report to proceed - believes case is resolvable.  Case is currently set for jury trial.  Michlig states anaylsis was completed by sheriff's dept.  Erickson requests status conference date.  Bail continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
State's Reply to Discovery continued
to Adjourn Hearing

03:14 pm - Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erickson states case not yet resolved - working on financial issues/forensic expert.  Michlig does not object to adjournment of jury trial.  Bail continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

01:40 pm - Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L. Erickson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erickson states proposal has been rec'd - not able to proceed at this time - do not have agreement at this time.  Erickson requests adjournment - currently set for jury trial on 12/18 and 12/19.  Court sets for final pretrial on 12/19/14 at 8:30 and reschedules jury trial date.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on November 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L. Erickson.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:08
In receipt of information , waive reading - not guilty plea
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court will also set for  2 day trial at this time
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

01:43 pm - Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  State calls Detective Philip Newcomb/Sworn/Direct by Michlig.  State submits to Court Exhibit 1 (Spreadsheet of Checks Written)-Marked, Exhibit 2 (Spreadsheet bank deposits)-Marked, Exhibit 3 (Spreadsheet-Checks/Deposits)-Marked & Rec'd.  Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Erickson.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

01:23 pm - Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in court, via video,  with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Defendant Brenda J. Wigglesworth in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading.  Michlig/Erickson to bond.  Court sets sig bond - set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
